title: Study of a Male Nude

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of graphite on pink wove paper with pink and blue fibers, altered to buff.

description: French artists in Rome often gathered at the Villa Medici for after-dinner drawing sessions. On one such occasion, in the company of Gustave Moreau, the young Degas made this study. The two artists depicted the same nude, but from different vantage points. Degas dated his study “1857 ”speculatively, many years later, but Moreau recorded “1858” at the time. The model’s dramatic pose—raised arm, eyes turned heavenward—was in keeping with the large-scale paintings favored by the French state in the 1850s. These tended to show heroic subject matter; the figure here could have been a potential prototype for a multifigure composition.
medium_display: Graphite on pink wove paper with pink and blue fibers, altered to buff
inscriptions: Inscribed recto, lower left, in graphite: "Rome. 1857"; verso, center, in graphite: "no. 3 / Ph2259 / 4"
credit_line: Gift of Dorothy Braude Edinburg to the Harry B. and Bessie K. Braude Memorial Collection
publication_history:
Theodore Reff, “New Light on Degas’s Copies,” Burlington Magazine, 106, 735 (June 1964), p. 251, no. 18.

Suzanne Folds McCullagh (ed.), Drawings in Dialogue: Old Master Through Modern, The Harry B. and Bessie K. Braude Memorial Collection, exh. cat. (Chicago: The Art Institute of Chicago, 2006), p. 103, cat. 68 (ill.).
exhibition_history:
St. Louis City Art Museum, "Drawings by Degas," Jan. 20–Feb. 26, 1967, p. 35, cat. 12.

Dayton Art Institute, "French Artists in Italy 1600-1900," Oct. 15–Nov. 28, 1971, cat. 52.

University Art Gallery, State University of New York at Binghamton, "Strictly Academic," Mar. 30–Apr. 24, 1974, p. 29, cat. 8.

Boston, Museum of Fine Arts, "Edgar Degas: The Reluctant Impressionist," June 20–Sept. 1, 1974, cat. 63.

Art Institute of Chicago, "Drawings in Dialogue: Old Master Through Modern, The Harry B. and Bessie K. Braude Memorial Collection," June 3–July 30, 2006, p. 103, cat. 68 (ill.).

Boston, Museum of Fine Arts, "Degas and the Nude",  Oct. 9, 2011-Feb. 5, 2012, p. 20, 21, fig. 15.

Art Institute of Chicago, "The Thrill of the Chase: Drawings for the Harry B. and Bessie K. Braude Memorial Collection," March 15-June 15, 2014, no cat.
provenance_text: Estate of the artist [stamp (Lugt 658) recto, lower left, in red and stamp (Lugt 657) verso, center, in red]; sold, 4th Degas estate sale, Galerie Georges Petit, Paris, July 2–4, 1919, lot 101c.  M. Viand.  Sold, Charles Slatkin Galleries, New York, to David Daniels, New York, 1964.  Sold, Christie’s, New York, May 11, 1995, lot 304, to Dorothy Braude Edinburg, Brookline, MA; given to the Art Institute of Chicago, 2013.
